subs.text: Succession spoiler poll: How will Son 1's campaign go?

Substack Notes is open. I have an account that I started a long time ago when I was trying out their newsletter publishing system. I ended up writing my own, because I didn't want to be locked in to using their editor. I like that I can edit my posts. Is there a character limit? I don't know. Can posts have titles? Where is the RSS feed for my posts? Does it support ActivityPub? Is there an API? The user interface is remarkably close to Twitter. More here.
Substack Notes is interesting because it starts with a high concentration of smart people who are good writers.
They also did something that Twitter never got around to. They started as a Medium and now are adding a Twitter. I think the UI can and should be factored.
But we're one day into Substack Notes and we have no idea what its interop profile is. They don't seem to have an interest in hooking up to other services, or that interest is private and secret.
Podcast: A rambling review of Substack Notes. 15 minutes.
NBA playoffs start tonight. Expect a fair amount of basketball writing in the coming weeks. After that, the baseball season begins in earnest for Uncle D.

I got an air fryer and had a chance to try it on a rib-eye steak yesterday, and omg it was sooo good. It took six minutes to cook, and then a few minutes to "rest" and it was as delicious as a steak off the grill, but without any of the work. I got the "budget pick" recommended by Wirecutter. It's easy to use, just plug it in and press some buttons. Not sure what I'll use the toaster oven for now.

I've been thinking a lot recently about how we're made to conform, and how stifling that can be, how depressing. But -- is there anything other than conforming? Is there any way for any of us to be unique? When I think of my friends, I think of their individuality. I don't think I judge anyone based on their conformity. But I think I am always judged negatively for not conforming. It's all very confusing. I'll let you know if I figure it out. :boom:
